definitions.definition: change from friendly to unfriendly relationship

source.author: Judith Martin, Nicholas Martin, Jacobina Martin
source.title: Miss Manners: Practice saying ‘I’ve got it, thanks’

exampleSentences.sentence: Coffee breaks, however, may be used for more than just coffee — if your husband promises to eat off-camera and adjust the room temperature quickly.

source.author: Samantha Pell
source.title: The Caps are dealing with an unexpected break. They hope to use it to recover and reset.

exampleSentences.sentence: The break in play, though unplanned, gives the once-ailing Capitals a chance to reset.

source.author: Carolyn Gramling
source.title: Three things to know about the disastrous flood in India

exampleSentences.sentence: Satellite images show that a section of a glacier broke off, but how that break relates to the subsequent floods is still unknown.

source.author: Matt Rogers
source.title: D.C.-area forecast: Cloudy and milder today before winter storm threats arrive

exampleSentences.sentence: We may see a precipitation break for a few hours in the afternoon as highs hold only in the 30s.

source.author: Emily Giambalvo
source.title: Maryland misses a chance to boost its NCAA tournament hopes with a loss to No. 4 Ohio State

exampleSentences.sentence: Maryland let the game slip away during a 13-minute stretch spanning both halves during which the Terps made only 1 of 15 field goal attempts, including nine straight misses after the break.

source.author: Michele  Norris
source.title: America suffered an unnecessary loss during the Super Bowl

exampleSentences.sentence: I wonder what the health-care workers who were fortunate enough to take a break from their front-line duties to attend the Super Bowl must have thought when they left the stadium Sunday night and saw the sea of revelers on the streets.

source.author: Aaron Pressman
source.title: Why Big Tech sat out the Super Bowl

exampleSentences.sentence: It’s maybe the one time of year I’m not hitting the Tivo fast-forward button during every ad break.

source.author: Becky Krystal
source.title: How to separate eggs without the stress or mess

exampleSentences.sentence: It’s something that can take some confidence to build up to and requires that you make a relatively clean break in the shell or else you may pierce the yolk.

source.author: Virginia M. Wright
source.title: The Ultimate Acadia National Park Travel Guide

exampleSentences.sentence: I take a break at Duck Brook Bridge, not because I need it—this is an easy ride—but because the bridge, with its three high arches and turreted viewing platforms, is beautiful.

source.author: Jenna Portnoy
source.title: Virginia assisted-living facility markets a ‘Vaccination Staycation’

exampleSentences.sentence: “Enjoy the Tall Oaks lifestyle and take a break from winter worries with a short-term respite stay,” the ad read, listing amenities such as chef-prepared meals and 24-hour access to nurses.
